title: In today’s world of advanced science and technology, we still greatly value our artists such as musicians, painters, and writers. What can art tell us about life that science and technology cannot? - Quora

response.answer_text: A scientist once told me, “If Michelangelo, or any of the other artistic geniuses, had never been born we would never have their art; but if Einstein had never been born all his discoveries would still have been discovered a bit later.” Great art is individual and unique; science is increasingly the product of collaboration, sometimes of hundreds of contributors.
